Authors: Im Hin Ooi, Sin Yeng Wong, Shook Ling Low
Title:
Kiewia (Schismatoglottideae: Araceae), a new genus for former
West Sunda Piptospatha species and notes on its pollination
Abstract:
Piptospatha is a genus of 15 species which are distributed
from Peninsular Malaysia (with one species, P. perakensis extending to
southern Thailand) to Borneo. This study analyse the phylogenetic signal
among Piptospatha species using nrITS and plastid matK regions. Eleven
accessions representing 10 taxa (including the Type, P. insignis) of
Piptospatha are included. Both gene regions are combined into a dataset
of 2547 base pairs and analysed using maximum likelihood and Bayesian
methods. The analyses have conclusively established the separation of
ex-Bornean taxa from the Bornean Piptospatha. Here, we proposed to
transfer P. ridleyi, P. perakensis and P. teijsmannii into a new genus,
Kiewia S.Y.Wong. Flowering mechanism, pollination strategy, and fruitset
of both Kiewia species are also presented.
